newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Surgical says court affirms dismissal.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Surgical says court affirms dismissal.

text.p: United States Surgical Corp said on Wednesday that a federal appeals court affirmed a lower courts decision to dismiss a patent infringement lawsuit brought against the company by a Johnson & Johnson unit.
Johnson & Johnson's Ethicon Endo-Surgery Inc claimed that U.S. Surgical's endoscopica and open GIA linear cutter staplers infringed upon its patent, U.S. Surgical said.
In his opinion last year, Judge S. Arthur Spiegel of U.S. District Court held that the U.S. Surgical's staplers do not infringe Ethicon's claims, leading the the appeal by Ethicon.
The appeals court remanded the case to the lower court for further findings as to whether any issues remain for trial, U.S. Surgical said.
"If none exist, summary judgment in USS's favor may be appropriate," the appeals court said.
Johnson & Johnson was not available for comment.
